resources.string: From Android 6.0 Marshmallow onwards the application requires Location permission in order to scan for Bluetooth Low Energy devices.\n\nThis is because Bluetooth LE beacons, for example iBeacons or Eddystone, may be used to determine the phone\'s and user\'s location. Mcu Mgr Sample will not use this information in any way.

From Android 6.0 Marshmallow onwards the application requires Location permission in order to scan for Bluetooth Low Energy devices, such as the Yale-Matter lock.\n\nThis is because Bluetooth LE beacons may be used to determine the phone\'s and user\'s location. The Yale Matter Lock Updater utility will not use this information in any way.
The Bluetooth adapter is turned off. Click the button below to enable it.

1. Make sure the device is turned on and is connected to a power source.

2. Make sure the firmware with SMP server is flashed and the device is advertising.

3. Check the filter settings. By default, the scanner displays only devices that advertise SMP service UUID (8D53DC1D–1DB7–4CD3–868B–8A527460AA84).

Locks will appear on this scan list for a short time after power-up.

 Power-cycle the lock:
 		• Remove at least one of the batteries
 		• Wait 10 seconds
 		• Re-insert the batteries
 
The lock should appear on this list for up to 30 seconds before it times out.

3. Location is turned off. Some Android phones require it enabled in order to scan for Bluetooth LE devices. If you are sure your device is advertising and it doesn\'t show up here, click the button below to enable Location.
